title: Check SQL Server in High Availability Group
body:
Checks for SQL Node currently being serving as primary on high availability group and sets Octopus variable : SQLIsOnSecondary to true if secondary is active in High Availability Group

---

### Step template checklist

- [x] `Id` should be a **GUID** that is not `00000000-0000-0000-0000-000000000000`
  - **NOTE** If you are modifying an existing step template, please make sure that you **do not** modify the `Id` property *(updating the `Id` will break the Library sync functionality in Octopus)*. 
- [x] `Version` should be incremented, otherwise the integration with Octopus won't update the step template correctly
- [x] Parameter names should not start with `$`
- [x] **To minimize the risk of step template parameters clashing with other variables in a project that uses the step template, ensure that you prefix your parameter names (e.g. an abbreviated name for the step template or the category of the step template**
- [x] `LastModifiedBy` field must be present, and (_optionally_) updated with the correct author
- [ ] If a new `Category` has been created:
   - [ ] An image with the name `{categoryname}.png` must be present under the `step-templates/logos` folder
   - [ ] The `switch` in the `humanize` function in [`gulpfile.babel.js`](https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/Library/blob/master/gulpfile.babel.js#L92) must have a `case` statement corresponding to it

Fixes # . _If there is an open issue that this PR fixes add it here, otherwise just remove this line_

title: Feature request: Ansible-Playbook (local)
body:
Whilst there is an AnsibleTower community template this requires that you have purchased ansible tower.  Since Octopus can do most of the tower functions for you, it's expensive overkill.

However, having a template that took a playbook file and (optionally) a variables file (both being able to be entered inline ( with the usual variable & transform options) or form a repo then executing them on the target directly would be of benefit.

it would have to check if ansible was already installed on the target and if not install that first.  This would only work on Linux boxes.  Or perhaps it could be installed on the octopus deployment nodes ( using the new linux subsystem or cgywin) which would then allow you to run ansible scripts on both windows and linux boxes

title: Question: Multi OS Templates
body:
I notice a number of community templates at first appear as if they work on for Windows & Linux but then when you go to use then you find they are Windows / PowerShell only.  Eg file system related or zip

It kind of feels wrong to me to create a separate set of templates that duplicate window sonly ones for linux.......

So 

In theory, you could install PowerShell on the Linux nodes (i've not tried to see if this works) and this seems the simplest way.

or could you have a multi-script template that had properties options for both OS's or for each script type supported eg something like
  "Properties": {
      "Octopus.Action.Script.Syntax": "PowerShell", [
           "Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptSource": "Inline",
            "Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptBody": "write-host this is powershell"
      ]
      "Octopus.Action.Script.Syntax": "Bash", [
           "Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptSource": "Inline",
            "Octopus.Action.Script.ScriptBody": "echo this is in bash /r /n"
      ]
  },

title: "Find Unreplaced Variables" step template doesn't warn on Windows2019 / Powershell 5.1.17763.503
body:
I've run into inconsistent behavior of a step template depending on Windows/Powershell version.  Details below - 

### Step template
"Find unreplaced variables" [variables-find-unreplaced.json](https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/Library/blob/master/step-templates/variables-find-unreplaced.json)  

### Step template parameter inputs
`Path = #{Octopus.Action[Previous Step].Output.Package.InstallationDirectoryPath}`
`Files = *.*`
`Recurse = True`
`Treat as an error? = #{TreatUnreplacedVariablesAsError}`  (Evaluates `False`)

### Step template version
24

### Step template related environment information

What I am finding is that on Windows 2019 deployment targets having the following Powershell version, the implementation ultimately winds up as an error requiring (in this case) failure guidance.

```
PS C:\Windows\system32> $PSVersionTable

Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      5.1.17763.503
PSEdition                      Desktop
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}
BuildVersion                   10.0.17763.503
CLRVersion                     4.0.30319.42000
WSManStackVersion              3.0
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
```

### Octopus Server version
v2019.5.10, but observed the same behavior on 2019.4.7 as well

### Expected behavior
I would expect this behavior to match the (correct) behavior that I observe on other deployment targets with lesser versions of Windows/Powershell

### Actual behavior

The block in question:
```
if (-not $clean) {
    $msg = "Unreplaced Octopus Variables were found."
    if ($TreatAsError) {
        Write-Error $msg
    } else {
        # Like writing a warning in Octopus. Writes to StandardError without 
        # returning a non-zero exit code from the script
        $host.ui.WriteErrorLine($msg)
    }
}
```

The `$host.ui.WriteErrorLine($msg)` line appears to be what is being picked up by Octopus as a legitimate error in this case (and requires failure guidance, which interrupts continuity of the deployment)

Example:
```
Searching for files in 'C:\Program Files\Company\DeployTools\Product'	Info	June 20th 2019 09:52:58
Found 'C:\Program Files\Company\DeployTools\Product\Product.config'.	Info	June 20th 2019 09:52:58
Searching for Octopus variables...done	Info	June 20th 2019 09:52:58
C:\Program Files\Company\DeployTools\Product\Product.config:6: <ConnectionString>#{OctoVariableName}</ConnectionString>	Info	June 20th 2019 09:52:58
Calamari.exe : Unreplaced Octopus Variables were found.	Error	June 20th 2019 09:52:59
At E:\Octopus\Work\20190620135255-20686-46\Bootstrap.ps1:27 char:1	Error	June 20th 2019 09:52:59
+ & "${env:TentacleHome}\Calamari\4.19.3\Calamari.exe" run-script -sen ...	Error	June 20th 2019 09:52:59
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~	Error	June 20th 2019 09:52:59
+ CategoryInfo : NotSpecified: (Unreplaced Octopus Variables were found.:String) [], RemoteException	Error	June 20th 2019 09:52:59
+ FullyQualifiedErrorId : NativeCommandError	Error	June 20th 2019 09:52:59
		
The remote script failed with exit code 1	Error	June 20th 2019 09:54:01
Guidance received: Ignore	Info	June 20th 2019 09:54:01
```

### Possible solution
I've copied the community template into my library and updated the line `$host.ui.WriteErrorLine($msg)` for `Write-Warning`, which appears to correct the issue.

```
Searching for files in 'C:\Program Files\Company\DeployTools\Product'	Info	June 20th 2019 10:15:00
Found 'C:\Program Files\Company\DeployTools\Product\Product.config'.	Info	June 20th 2019 10:15:01
Searching for Octopus variables...done	Info	June 20th 2019 10:15:01
C:\Program Files\Company\DeployTools\Product\Product.config:6: <ConnectionString>#{OctoVariableName}</ConnectionString>	Info	June 20th 2019 10:15:01
Unreplaced Octopus Variables were found.	Warning	June 20th 2019 10:15:01
```

title: Deploy SSRS Reports from a package: Reportname cannot contain dot's ('.')
body:
### Step template
Deploy SSRS Reports from a package

### Step template parameter inputs
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5759571/54809812-a8a09100-4c84-11e9-839b-377a27a80ee3.png)


### Step template version
"Version": 51

### Step template related environment information
_If the step template is for a specific software/hardware, please provide as much information about the software/hardware as possible to make it easy for us to replicate the issue_

### Octopus Server version
Octopus v2018.7.11

### Expected behavior
Deploying a SSRS report file named 'MyFirstReport.rdl' should result in a report named 'MyFirstReport'.
Deploying a SSRS report file named 'MySecondReport.A01.rdl' should result in a report named 'MySecondReport.A01'.


### Actual behavior

Deploying a SSRS report file named 'MyFirstReport.rdl' results in a report named 'MyFirstReport': OK
Deploying a SSRS report file named 'MySecondReport.A01.rdl' results in a report named 'MySecondReport': Not OK.


### Possible solution
The PowerShell script determines the name of the report, based on the filename, by using this approach to exclude the extension '.rdl' from the reportname:
`    $ItemName = $ItemFile.SubString($ItemFile.LastIndexOf("\") + 1)`
`    $ItemName = $ItemName.SubString(0, $ItemName.IndexOf("."))`

the part
`IndexOf(".")`
searches for the first '.' so the part of the filename until the first '.' will be the reportname. 

It might be better to search for the last '.', so 
`    $ItemName = $ItemFile.SubString($ItemFile.LastIndexOf("\") + 1)`
`    $ItemName = $ItemName.SubString(0, $ItemName.LastIndexOf("."))`

This works good in our situation. This ''



### Steps to reproduce the problem (for bugs)

Try to deploy multiple reports:
- at least one with only one '.' in the name (ie: 'MyFirstReport.rdl')
- at least one with multiple '.' in the name (ie: 'MySecondReport.A01.rdl')

Check the names of the reports in SSRS.

title: Deployment of DACPAC Failing on Data Loss
body:
### Step template
SQL - Deploy DACPAC

### Step template parameter inputs
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1525573/48395790-0a724c80-e721-11e8-977d-b65dfd3ab584.png)
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1525573/48395818-1cec8600-e721-11e8-9b5d-ea44296e973f.png)

### Step template version
Version 11

### Step template related environment information

### Octopus Server version
v2018.8.11

### Expected behavior
When using the "Additional deployment contributor arguments" BlockOnPossibleDataLoss set to false, i.e. /p:BlockOnPossibleDataLoss=false as would be used in a manual dacpac deploy, the deployment should allow for columns to be dropped, even if there are rows in the table.

### Actual behavior
This parameter seems to be ignored and the deployment fails due to the fact that there are rows in the table where I am trying to drop a column.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1525573/48396084-ecf1b280-e721-11e8-819c-6ae0b467d106.png)

### Possible solution
Ensure that the arguments are actually being included and that they are being included correctly.

### Steps to reproduce the problem (for bugs)
Take any working dacpac deployment step.
Add the above argument.
Change the dacpac to drop a column of a table that has rows.
Attempt to deploy the dacapac.

title: Template "IIS Application - Create" Intermittent Failures
body:
### Step template
IIS Application - Create

### Step template parameter inputs
See attached images (
![templateparams](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43546890/46368786-b6b31480-c646-11e8-9695-7f80295f03bf.png)
![templateparams2](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43546890/46368796-bca8f580-c646-11e8-9f59-1d0fa1d751e6.png).)

### Step template version
Version 36

### Step template related environment information
This is happening for IIS on Windows Server 2012 R2.
![iis](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/43546890/46368807-c7fc2100-c646-11e8-9ba9-a9e896ac540b.png)

### Octopus Server version
Octopus v2018.8.1

### Expected behavior
Update/Create IIS Application.

### Actual behavior
Intermittent failures when running deployments.  Usually this will be successful on 1 server, but fail on the other.  The failures occur on both servers, not always the same server.  Rerunning the deployment for the tenant that failed will succeed.  See the attachments for error details (
[Exception.txt](https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/Library/files/2439199/Exception.txt).)
Sometimes these errors are related to other processes writing to the file (
[Exception2.txt](https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/Library/files/2439200/Exception2.txt).)

### Possible solution
I wish I could provide a possible solution, but I am not sure how this could be fixed.

### Steps to reproduce the problem (for bugs)
Create 25 process steps that run in parallel and use the IIS Application - Create step template to add an web application to a site in IIS (this would mimic our process.)
Run a deploy (may take a few to get the issue as it doesn't always happen.)

title: Investigate Configuration - Encrypt Section step template compatibility with Server 2008R2
Slack Server Error Causes Build Failure
body:
### Step template
Slack - Send Simple Notification
https://github.com/OctopusDeploy/Library/blob/master/step-templates/slack-send-simple-notification.json

### Step template parameter inputs
Any configuration will replicate

### Step template version
Version 7

### Step template related environment information
No requirements

### Octopus Server version
3.12.8

### Expected behavior

Continue on error

### Actual behavior

Build failure causing a full rollback

### Possible solution
Either swallow Slack failures entirely, or add an option to swallow them.  Could also create a retry.

### Description
While Slack is typically reliable, occasionally service errors do happen.  This step does not handle them gracefully.  Instead, it causes a step failure, and since Octopus cannot currently be configured to ignore step errors, it causes a full deployment rollback.

For build failures, this may be acceptable, since your build is already failed.  But in other cases, it's not.  In our case it was actually notifying of a _successful_ deploy, so ironically, this step rolled back a deploy that was complete, and successful.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/835300/34219840-249be22a-e578-11e7-9930-cae11f758f77.png)

title: Step template client side support
body:

None, this is a suggestion for Octopus Deploy client side support.

### Step template parameter inputs
I would expect the step template to take a URL much like the custom template HTTP - Invoke URL

### Step template version
None

### Step template related environment information
None

### Octopus Server version
3.13.3

### Expected behavior
I would like to supply a URL in the step that would open a new tab with that URL loaded.
When we deploy there are a number of addresses we like to check first before proceeding, at the moment we have to put them in the Manual Intervention step and copy and paste them into a browser one by one which surprisingly takes some time. Client side access for steps would enable us to do a simple javascript window open. I know this may have it's risks but it would sure help.

### Actual behavior
None

### Possible solution
None

### Steps to reproduce the problem (for bugs)
None

title: Set-ItemProperty : Time, Requests, Schedule, Memory, IsapiUnhealthy, OnDemand,  ConfigChange, PrivateMemory is not a valid value for Int32.
body:
Thanks for reporting an issue! Please make sure you click the link above to view the issue guidelines.

This repository is a collection of community step templates where the majority of step templates were written by members of the Octopus Deploy community, not the Octopus team.

If you are reporting a bug with a specific step template, we'd really appreciate it if you could send a PR with a fix for the bug. 
If you want to send a PR but you're not sure how to create a PR, see GitHub's excellent [Pull Request guides](https://help.github.com/articles/proposing-changes-to-your-work-with-pull-requests/). Note that sending your own PR will give you a faster resolution than the below options.

If you can't send a PR, that's all good, we understand! A member of the Octopus team will take a look at your issue and make sure that we get a fix merged as soon as convenient. 
**Please note** that it might take a bit longer to get a fix out there depending on what step template and what the bug is as it might require some setup to replicate the bug.

Please provide the following information when submitting an issue.

_Before submitting your issue, please delete everything above the line below._

---

### Step template
IIS AppPool - Update Recycle Settings

### Step template parameter inputs
_Please show us how you have configured your step template, to make it easier for us to replicate the issue (screenshots is OK)_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33482395/32543170-c2452428-c46c-11e7-9015-26bd148c1ca2.png)

### Step template version
3 then upgraded to 6, same issue.

### Step template related environment information
_If the step template is for a specific software/hardware, please provide as much information about the software/hardware as possible to make it easy for us to replicate the issue_

### Octopus Server version
3.17.10

### Expected behavior

Adding multiple items in the Recycle Events To Log field e.g.  Time, Requests, Schedule, Memory, IsapiUnhealthy, OnDemand, ConfigChange, PrivateMemory should allow the step to work
1, 2, 4, 8, 16, 32, 64, 128 
### Actual behavior
We can only add 1 item in this field not multiple

_What is actually happening_
The step fails with following error: 
Set-ItemProperty : Time, Requests, Schedule, Memory, IsapiUnhealthy, OnDemand,  ConfigChange, PrivateMemory is not a valid value for Int32.

### Possible solution
_If you might have an idea of what the issue is, please let us know_

### Steps to reproduce the problem (for bugs)

_If there are specific steps that you took when you encountered the bug, please list them here_
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/33482395/32543368-53b3b5e6-c46d-11e7-9536-ca4eb42df1a1.png)

title: Dacpac can't extract if the database doesn't exist.  Chicken and Egg...
body:
### Step template:  sql-deploy-dacpac.json
### Step template version: Version 8
### Expected behavior: Create a database
### Actual behavior:  Login failure...  but its not a permissions issue.  Its a "the database doesn't exist, so you can't log into it" issue.
### Possible solution:  Put a check inside the part of the code that is going to do the "Extract" of the dacpac to see if the database is already created.  If it is, then allow the extract, if its a New database, then do not extract, as an extract is "doomed" to fail since their is no database there YET.  If you don't change this, then in the parameter description say something about it as its not obvious until you debug it.  At my place, I'd prefer to run the exact same Octopus project on a target server that has the database already and a target server that does not have the database on it.  We try to have one project for both "changes and creates" and we run most projects on dozens of machines in Dev/Test/Stage/Prod.  We have new machines all of the time and we want to deploy changes as well.

### Steps to reproduce the problem (for bugs)
1. Try to create a database with a dacpac and select all of the check boxes in the step template.  Report/Script/Extract target database to dacpac.

The step fails because the database doesn't exist yet.

title: Template "diffability"
body:
Happy to send a PR after a quick discussion on this. It's not a lot of work but there are a few different options.

It would be helpful to see changes between versions of step template scripts. While this is technically achievable by looking at the string in the JSON, it makes for a challenging review. Ideally we could see the changes to the unpacked scripts.

I have a few thoughts on how to do accomplish this:

1.  Store the unpacked templates in a subdirectory of `step-templates` or alongside the JSON files like `_unpack.ps1` currently does.
2.  Make sure that the subdir is kept in sync with the JSON:
     - Add a placeholder in the JSON instead of storing the script contents. Add a build step to combine them. It might make sense to move the JSON to a `metadata` subdir as well so the website build still works seamlessly.
     - Keep the JSON as-is and add a build step that validates that the script contents are in-sync. Fail the build if not. This adds more overhead to the development effort (have to remember to run the sync before submitting a PR), but makes the build a bit simpler.

OR

- Don't change anything in the current repo but have the build produce a diff of the unpacked scripts and attach the diff to the PR as a comment. You can't comment on specific lines this way but it at least helps with review.

I also suspect this will make running automated tests a bit easier.

title: Many things are broken in IE11
body:
Having  downloaded and tested the library on a Win7 - IE11 (https://developer.microsoft.com/en-us/microsoft-edge/tools/vms/) machine. It appears as though the `Copy to clipboard` button does not work on IE.

Based on the 3rd party [react-copy-to-clipboard](https://github.com/nkbt/react-copy-to-clipboard) library used it appears that this should work on IE11. Testing their demo page (http://nkbt.github.io/react-copy-to-clipboard/) indeed shows that in theory this should be working.
